headline: Musk's SpaceX Said to Weigh Tie-Up With Tesla or xAI
summary: SpaceX is said to be considering a potential merger with Tesla or xAI, as Elon Musk weighs how to consolidate his empire. Bloomberg Tech's Ed Ludlow discusses what's at stake on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade."

content.title: Musk's SpaceX Said to Weigh Tie-Up With Tesla or xAI
content.description: SpaceX is said to be considering a potential merger with Tesla or xAI, as Elon Musk weighs how to consolidate his empire. Bloomberg Tech's Ed Ludlow discusses what's at stake on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade."
content.summary: SpaceX is said to be considering a potential merger with Tesla or xAI, as Elon Musk weighs how to consolidate his empire. Bloomberg Tech's Ed Ludlow discusses what's at stake on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade."

headline: SpaceX in merger talks with other Musk companies ahead of IPO
summary:
STORY: SpaceX is exploring deals with other companies helmed by Elon Musk.

The rocket maker is in discussions to merge with artificial intelligence company xAI ahead of a blockbuster public offering planned for this year.

The combination would bring Musk’s rockets, Starlink satellites, social media platform X and Grok chatbot under one roof.

That's according to a person briefed on the matter and two regulatory filings.

SpaceX is also considering a merger with Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla, according to Bloomberg.

The world's richest man is CEO of SpaceX and xAI, which controls X.

He also runs Tesla, tunnel firm The Boring Company, and neurotechnology outfit Neuralink.

Neither Musk nor any of the firms responded to requests for comment.

Shares in Tesla rose 3% in after-hours trade Thursday.

Some of its shareholders have long advocated bringing Musk's companies together.

Stock Trader Network chief market strategist Dennis Dick says a major risk thesis for Tesla is that "Musk is spreading himself out too much." 

For SpaceX, a massive deal could complicate its IPO plans.

But it might add momentum to efforts to launch data centers into orbit, a key goal for Musk in the escalating AI race. 

xAI shares would be exchanged for SpaceX shares if the two merged. 

A Reuters source says no final agreement has been signed and the deal timing and structure remain fluid.

content.title: SpaceX in merger talks with other Musk companies ahead of IPO
content.summary:
STORY: SpaceX is exploring deals with other companies helmed by Elon Musk.

The rocket maker is in discussions to merge with artificial intelligence company xAI ahead of a blockbuster public offering planned for this year.

The combination would bring Musk’s rockets, Starlink satellites, social media platform X and Grok chatbot under one roof.

That's according to a person briefed on the matter and two regulatory filings.

SpaceX is also considering a merger with Musk's electric vehicle maker Tesla, according to Bloomberg.

The world's richest man is CEO of SpaceX and xAI, which controls X.

He also runs Tesla, tunnel firm The Boring Company, and neurotechnology outfit Neuralink.

Neither Musk nor any of the firms responded to requests for comment.

Shares in Tesla rose 3% in after-hours trade Thursday.

Some of its shareholders have long advocated bringing Musk's companies together.

Stock Trader Network chief market strategist Dennis Dick says a major risk thesis for Tesla is that "Musk is spreading himself out too much." 

For SpaceX, a massive deal could complicate its IPO plans.

But it might add momentum to efforts to launch data centers into orbit, a key goal for Musk in the escalating AI race. 

xAI shares would be exchanged for SpaceX shares if the two merged. 

A Reuters source says no final agreement has been signed and the deal timing and structure remain fluid.

headline: Tesla Reorients From Premium EVs To Optimus Robots And xAI Future

The company is expanding its autonomous technology efforts and committing $2b to Elon Musk's AI startup xAI. Rumors are circulating about a potential merger between Tesla and either SpaceX or xAI, which could reshape the group structure around AI, robotics, and autonomy. headline: Elon Musk’s SpaceX Said to Consider Merger With Tesla or xAI
summary: The firm has discussed the feasibility of a tie-up between SpaceX and Tesla, an idea that some investors are pushing, the people said, asking not to be identified as the information isn’t public.  Separately, they are also exploring a tie-up between SpaceX and xAI ahead of an IPO, some of the people said.  Musk and representatives for SpaceX, xAI and Tesla didn’t respond to requests for comment.

headline: Tesla jumps as SpaceX merger talks fuel Musk empire consolidation hopes
summary: Shares of Tesla jumped more than 5% on Friday, after reports that SpaceX was in deal talks with Elon Musk's other ​companies stoked investor hopes that the billionaire's tech empire could be unified ‌further.  SpaceX is in discussions to merge with Musk's AI startup, xAI, ahead of a blockbuster public offering ‌planned for this year, Reuters reported on Thursday.  Separately, Bloomberg also reported that SpaceX is considering a merger with Tesla.

Separately, Bloomberg also reported that SpaceX is considering a merger with Tesla.

headline: Battery Energy Storage System Market to Reach US$ 68.22 Billion by 2033 Driven by Renewable Energy Integration and Grid Stability Says Astute Analytica

headline: Tesla climbs as SpaceX merger talks fuel Musk empire consolidation hopes
summary: Shares of Tesla jumped nearly 5% on Friday after reports that SpaceX was in deal talks with Elon Musk's other companies stoked investor ​hopes that the billionaire's tech empire could be unified further.  SpaceX is in discussions ‌to merge with Musk's AI startup, xAI, ahead of a blockbuster public offering planned for this year, Reuters ‌reported on Thursday.  Separately, Bloomberg News reported that SpaceX is considering a merger with Tesla.

content.title: Tesla climbs as SpaceX merger talks fuel Musk empire consolidation hopes
content.summary: Shares of Tesla jumped nearly 5% on Friday after reports that SpaceX was in deal talks with Elon Musk's other companies stoked investor ​hopes that the billionaire's tech empire could be unified further.  SpaceX is in discussions ‌to merge with Musk's AI startup, xAI, ahead of a blockbuster public offering planned for this year, Reuters ‌reported on Thursday.  Separately, Bloomberg News reported that SpaceX is considering a merger with Tesla.

headline: Will Elon Musk Really Merge SpaceX with Tesla Before Its IPO?
summary: SpaceX is exploring a potential merger with Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) or xAI as it prepares for an initial public offering targeted for mid-June 2026, according to reports from Bloomberg and Reuters. The IPO could raise up to $50 billion and value SpaceX at about $1.5 trillion, surpassing Saudi Aramco‘s 2019 listing as the largest ever. Discussions ... Will Elon Musk Really Merge SpaceX with Tesla Before Its IPO?

headline: US stocks fall while a break in gold fever sends metals prices screeching lower
summary: Financial markets are churning on Friday as investors try to figure out what President Donald Trump’s new nominee to lead the Federal Reserve will mean for interest rates.  The value of the U.S. dollar, meanwhile, climbed but only after swiveling a couple times following Trump’s nomination of Kevin Warsh.  Whoever leads the Fed has a big influence on the economy and markets worldwide by helping to dictate where the U.S. central bank moves interest rates.

content.title: US stocks fall while a break in gold fever sends metals prices screeching lower
content.summary: Financial markets are churning on Friday as investors try to figure out what President Donald Trump’s new nominee to lead the Federal Reserve will mean for interest rates.  The value of the U.S. dollar, meanwhile, climbed but only after swiveling a couple times following Trump’s nomination of Kevin Warsh.  Whoever leads the Fed has a big influence on the economy and markets worldwide by helping to dictate where the U.S. central bank moves interest rates.

headline: Can Optimus Save Tesla (TSLA) From Sinking?
summary: Elon Musk believes that humanoid robots dubbed Optimus will help take Tesla (TSLA) to another level. Our 24/7 Wall St. Analysts explore whether or not the company and its investors could enjoy a nice run in 2026, and if Optimus will be anywhere near as big for Musk as he seems to think.

headline: SpaceX’s IPO could open the floodgates — and secondaries are booming in the meantime

headline: Analysis-Combining SpaceX with xAI may be simple for Musk Inc, but Tesla isn't so easy
summary: Elon Musk fans and the man himself have long mused about Musk Inc, a merger of companies owned by the world's richest man.  Reuters reported on Thursday that SpaceX is close to a deal to buy xAI, a move that would pave the ‌way for Musk's plans to launch data centers in space, which he calls the best place for the power-hungry machines.  As two private Musk-owned entities, the path to that merger could be much smoother than a possible tie-up of SpaceX and Tesla, ‌which some investors believe also could happen eventually.

content.title: Analysis-Combining SpaceX with xAI may be simple for Musk Inc, but Tesla isn't so easy
content.summary: Elon Musk fans and the man himself have long mused about Musk Inc, a merger of companies owned by the world's richest man.  Reuters reported on Thursday that SpaceX is close to a deal to buy xAI, a move that would pave the ‌way for Musk's plans to launch data centers in space, which he calls the best place for the power-hungry machines.  As two private Musk-owned entities, the path to that merger could be much smoother than a possible tie-up of SpaceX and Tesla, ‌which some investors believe also could happen eventually.
